page.title: 08WEXLAND FARM
page.content: { Wexland}Farm,farmed by the same family since 1920,is to the west of the main,A345,road. The farmhouse was built in 1700 from bricks, flint and mortar. The farm consists of{1400 acres}and is rented from the{Ministry of {Defence.}Farming is concentrated on cereal crops including wheat, barley; oil seed rape and triticale and beef stock rearing. Each of the 100 calves wears an ear tag which contains a fly-killer as a preventative against New Forest Eye Disease. The total number of workers now employed is four. The machinery is very modern and includes two combines, four tractors,three lorries to collect bales and one to carry grain from the harvest field to four grain silos each of which holds sixty tons of grain. {
